meaning: Meaning: Even one who has achieved a high level of yoga (spiritual practice) can fall down below. (by Adi Shankaracharya)Explanation: This verse is a simple statement made by Adi Shankaracharya, a renowned philosopher and spiritual teacher of ancient India. He emphasizes that even someone who has attained an elevated state of spiritual practice, represented by the term "yoga", can face setbacks or regressions in their spiritual growth. It serves as a reminder that in the journey of spiritual progress, one must remain vigilant and aware of the potential pitfalls and challenges that may come along the way.
